leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 材料-DFT 生态（输入/求解/后处理）
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 结构生成→DFT→后处理→高通量→验证

queries: [WEB] open source dft codes materials science github
[WEB] python interface for quantum espresso github
[WEB] density functional theory software list github

tools.name: High-Entropy-Alloys
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating random alloy structures and computing properties for High Entropy Alloys
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to generate random crystal structures for high-entropy alloys (HEAs) and compute various physical properties, facilitating materials design and simulation.

tools.name: VaspStudio
tools.one_line_profile: Automation tool for VASP job submission, management, and energy extraction
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool designed to streamline the workflow of VASP calculations on HPC systems, including job submission, file management, and automatic extraction of calculation results.

tools.name: CPMD
tools.one_line_profile: Parallelized plane wave/pseudopotential DFT code for ab-initio molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A production-grade implementation of Density Functional Theory, specifically optimized for Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics (CPMD). It supports parallel execution and uses plane waves and pseudopotentials.

tools.name: VASP2WAN90_v2_fix
tools.one_line_profile: Updated interface converting VASP wavefunctions to Wannier90 format
tools.detailed_description: A fixed and updated version of the VASP2WANNIER90 interface, enabling the projection of VASP bloch states onto Wannier functions for post-processing.

tools.name: VASP_OPT_AXIS
tools.one_line_profile: Patch for VASP to fix specific lattice components during relaxation
tools.detailed_description: A modification tool for VASP source code that allows users to selectively fix lattice vectors during structural relaxation, providing more control than standard constraints.

tools.name: pyw90
tools.one_line_profile: Interface between VASP and Wannier90 for automated projection analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that interfaces VASP and Wannier90 to automate disentanglement energy window optimization and projection analysis.

tools.name: DMFTwDFT
tools.one_line_profile: Solver combining DMFT with various DFT packages
tools.detailed_description: An open-source code that integrates Dynamical Mean Field Theory (DMFT) with Density Functional Theory (DFT) solvers to treat strongly correlated electron systems.

tools.name: vaspvis
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for VASP electronic structure data
tools.detailed_description: A flexible Python library for visualizing electronic structure data (such as band structures and density of states) directly from VASP calculation outputs.

tools.name: ELSI Interface
tools.one_line_profile: Interface connecting electronic structure codes with high-performance solvers
tools.detailed_description: A software interface layer that allows electronic structure codes (DFT) to seamlessly connect with various high-performance solver libraries like ELPA, PEXSI, and NTPoly. Maintained by the Electronic Structure Library (ESL).

tools.name: pymatgen-io-espresso
tools.one_line_profile: Pymatgen addon for parsing Quantum ESPRESSO files
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the pymatgen library specifically designed to parse input and output files from Quantum ESPRESSO, facilitating data analysis and workflow construction.

tools.name: VASPBERRY
tools.one_line_profile: Berry curvature and Chern number calculator for VASP
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran code designed to calculate Berry curvature and Chern numbers using the WAVECAR output from VASP calculations, useful for topological materials research.

tools.name: VASPilot
tools.one_line_profile: AI-driven automation tool for VASP calculations
tools.detailed_description: An automatic tool utilizing multi-agent frameworks (CrewAI) to manage and execute VASP calculations, aiming to streamline the DFT simulation workflow.

tools.name: pyscf_TDDFT_ris
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient TDDFT-ris implementation based on PySCF
tools.detailed_description: An efficient implementation of Time-Dependent Density Functional Theory (TDDFT) using Resolution of Identity (RI) approximation, built upon MOKIT and PySCF libraries.

tools.name: FLEUR
tools.one_line_profile: All-electron full-potential linearized augmented plane wave DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, all-electron Density Functional Theory code based on the Full-Potential Linearized Augmented Plane Wave (FLAPW) method. Developed by the JuDFT team at Jülich Research Centre.

tools.name: aiida-fleur
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the FLEUR DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the FLEUR code, enabling high-throughput and automated electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: aiida-kkr
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the JuKKR Green function code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the JuKKR (Korringa-Kohn-Rostoker) code, facilitating automated KKR-Green function calculations.

tools.name: DFTK.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Density-functional theory toolkit in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for playing with plane-wave density-functional theory algorithms. It provides a framework for developing and testing new DFT methods and performing electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: cp2k-2-deepmdkit
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from CP2K output to DeepMD-kit input
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for converting CP2K ab initio molecular dynamics output data into the input format required for training machine learning potentials with DeepMD-kit.

tools.name: VaSP
tools.one_line_profile: Vascular fluid-structure-interaction simulation tools
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for pre-processing, simulating, and post-processing vascular fluid-structure-interaction problems, including mesh generation and hemodynamic analysis.

tools.name: MGmol
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable O(N) First-Principles Molecular Dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: A scalable O(N) First-Principles Molecular Dynamics code capable of performing large-scale electronic structure calculations and molecular dynamics simulations of atomistic systems using real-space multigrid methods.

tools.name: Qball
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles molecular dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: A first-principles molecular dynamics code used to compute the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, solids, and liquids within the Density Functional Theory (DFT) formalism. Fork of Qbox.

tools.name: Dipole-ACF
tools.one_line_profile: IR spectrum calculation from Dipole Autocorrelation Function
tools.detailed_description: A script for calculating the Infrared (IR) spectrum based on the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) of the Auto-Correlation Function of total dipole moment data generated from CP2K AIMD simulations.

tools.name: qeAPI
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: An interface/API between Quantum ESPRESSO and Python, allowing for the manipulation and execution of QE calculations within a Python environment.

tools.name: MatPL
tools.one_line_profile: Material Potential Library for ML force fields
tools.detailed_description: Formerly PWMLFF, this package is designed to rapidly generate machine learning force fields with accuracy comparable to Ab Initio Molecular Dynamics (AIMD).

tools.name: mcpdft
tools.one_line_profile: MC-PDFT extension for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: A standalone PySCF extension module implementing Multi-Configuration Pair-Density Functional Theory (MC-PDFT).

tools.name: QuantumESPRESSOBase.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia infrastructure for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: Provides basic data structures and functions for manipulating Quantum ESPRESSO structures, generating input files, and performing error checks in Julia.

tools.name: MiniDFT
tools.one_line_profile: Minimalist Quantum ESPRESSO for benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A minimalist version of Quantum ESPRESSO that performs only LDA total energy and gradient calculations, designed for exploring parallelization schemes and benchmarking computer architectures.

tools.name: BigDFT-launchpad
tools.one_line_profile: Development repository for BigDFT
tools.detailed_description: A repository for feature development of the BigDFT code, a DFT code based on Daubechies wavelets.

tools.name: ThermoPot
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamic potential calculator
tools.detailed_description: Python package for calculating thermodynamic potentials from first-principles calculations.

tools.name: Matlab_Real_Space
tools.one_line_profile: Real-space electronic structure code
tools.detailed_description: Electronic structure code for molecules and clusters implemented in MATLAB, using real-space methods (PARSEC project related).

tools.name: FermiLib-Plugin-PySCF
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF plugin for FermiLib
tools.detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of PySCF (Python Simulation of Chemistry Framework) within FermiLib for quantum computing applications in chemistry.

tools.name: VASPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for manipulating VASP files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for manipulating VASP input/output files, facilitating pre-processing and post-processing of VASP calculations.

tools.name: Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated suite for electronic-structure calculations
tools.detailed_description: An integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.

tools.name: q-e_schrodinger
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum ESPRESSO for Schrödinger Suite
tools.detailed_description: A version of Quantum ESPRESSO tailored for integration into Schrödinger’s Materials Science Suite.

tools.name: qexsd
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum Espresso XML Schema Tools
tools.detailed_description: Python tools for handling Quantum ESPRESSO XML Schema based documents, facilitating data extraction and input generation.

tools.name: QMCPACK
tools.one_line_profile: Many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code
tools.detailed_description: An open-source production level many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code for computing the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, and solids, with GPU support.

tools.name: Hefei-NAMD
tools.one_line_profile: Ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics program
tools.detailed_description: A program for performing ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations, useful for studying excited state dynamics.

tools.name: VaspBandUnfolding
tools.one_line_profile: Band unfolding scripts for VASP
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts for processing VASP outputs, specifically for unfolding electronic band structures of supercells to primitive cells.

tools.name: VaspVib2XSF
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizer for VASP vibrational modes
tools.detailed_description: A tool to visualize vibrational modes calculated by VASP by converting them to XSF format for viewing in XCrySDen or VESTA.

tools.name: pyscf-ac0
tools.one_line_profile: CAS-AC0 implementation for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: An extension for PySCF implementing the CAS-AC0 method for electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: RMGDFT
tools.one_line_profile: Real-space Multigrid DFT code
tools.detailed_description: RMG is an open-source code for electronic structure calculations and modeling of materials and molecules, based on density functional theory using real-space basis and pseudopotentials.

tools.name: SALMON
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles electron dynamics simulator for optics and nanoscience
tools.detailed_description: SALMON (Scalable Ab-initio Light-Matter simulator for Optics and Nanoscience) is a software package for first-principles electron dynamics calculations based on time-dependent density functional theory (TDDFT).

tools.name: pycp2k
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the CP2K atomistic simulation software
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper and interface for CP2K, allowing users to drive CP2K simulations and handle input/output within a Python environment.

tools.name: ShakeNBreak
tools.one_line_profile: Defect structure-searching method using chemically-guided bond distortions
tools.detailed_description: A package to generate defect structures with chemically-guided bond distortions to aid in identifying ground-state defect configurations in materials.

tools.name: doped
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow tool for defect supercell calculations and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python software for the generation, pre-/post-processing, and analysis of defect supercell calculations, streamlining the defect simulation workflow.

tools.name: easyunfold
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for unfolding band structures from supercell calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate band structure unfolding, making it easier to analyze the electronic structure of supercells.

tools.name: surfaxe
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for slab generation and surface calculation setup
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for generating and handling slab structures for first-principles surface calculations, automating the setup of surface models.

tools.name: CellConstructor
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for atomic structure handling and SSCHA interfacing
tools.detailed_description: Python utilities to handle atomic structures and interface with common formats (XYZ, Quantum ESPRESSO), primarily used within the SSCHA (Stochastic Self-Consistent Harmonic Approximation) workflow.

tools.name: XtraCrysPy
tools.one_line_profile: Crystallographic visualizer for Python compatible with DFT outputs
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for crystallographic structures, supporting file formats from major DFT codes like Quantum ESPRESSO, VASP, and CP2K.

tools.name: TITAN
tools.one_line_profile: Tight-binding suite for electronic structure of nanomaterials
tools.detailed_description: A tight-binding code suite designed for calculating the electronic structure of nanomaterials, developed at Forschungszentrum Jülich.

tools.name: Tramonto
tools.one_line_profile: DFT software for modeling nanostructured fluids
tools.detailed_description: Software for modeling nanostructured fluids using Density Functional Theories (classical DFT) and Trilinos solvers.

tools.name: MacroDensity
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of electron density and electrostatic potential grids
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to read and analyse electron density and electrostatic potential grid files from electronic structure calculations (e.g. VASP).

tools.name: Occupation-matrix-control-in-VASP
tools.one_line_profile: Patch for VASP to enable occupation matrix control
tools.detailed_description: A modification/patch for the VASP code to allow for explicit control of the occupation matrix, useful for studying specific electronic configurations.

tools.name: Hefei-NAMD
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio non-adiabatic molecular dynamics program
tools.detailed_description: Hefei-NAMD is a program for performing ab initio non-adiabatic molecular dynamics based on TDDFT and surface hopping methods to investigate ultrafast carrier dynamics.

tools.name: GradDFT
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based library for differentiable design of XC functionals
tools.detailed_description: GradDFT is a library built on JAX that enables the differentiable design and experimentation of exchange-correlation functionals in Density Functional Theory using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: DynaPhoPy
tools.one_line_profile: Phonon anharmonicity analysis from molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Software to calculate phonon properties (frequencies, linewidths) and analyze anharmonicity from molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: Abinit
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles simulation software for materials science
tools.detailed_description: ABINIT is a software suite to calculate the optical, mechanical, vibrational, and other observable properties of materials using Density Functional Theory and Many-Body Perturbation Theory.

tools.name: AbiPy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analyzing ABINIT results
tools.detailed_description: AbiPy is a Python library to analyze the results produced by ABINIT, facilitating post-processing, visualization, and workflow automation.

tools.name: Quantum ESPRESSO (AdvanceSoft Mirror)
tools.one_line_profile: Redistribution of Quantum ESPRESSO binaries and source
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing compiled binaries and sources of Quantum ESPRESSO, an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations.

tools.name: HEA-ML
tools.one_line_profile: High-entropy alloy design using DFT and ML
tools.detailed_description: An application for designing high-entropy alloys (specifically Al-Fe-Co-Cr-Ni systems) by combining first-principles calculations and machine learning.

tools.name: aiida-vasp
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for VASP simulations
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that enables running, managing, and analyzing VASP simulations in a reproducible manner.

tools.name: aiidalab-qe
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDAlab application for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: An application for AiiDAlab that provides a user-friendly interface to run Quantum ESPRESSO calculations via AiiDA.

tools.name: aiida-cp2k
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for CP2K
tools.detailed_description: The official CP2K plugin for the AiiDA workflow and provenance engine, allowing for the automation of CP2K calculations.

tools.name: aiida-quantumespresso
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO, enabling the integration of QE calculations into AiiDA workflows.

tools.name: qe-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python tools for parsing and generating Quantum ESPRESSO input/output files, often used in conjunction with AiiDA.

tools.name: Py_xDH
tools.one_line_profile: XYG3 type density functional implementation for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation and interface for XYG3 type doubly hybrid density functionals within the PySCF framework.

tools.name: DFTQuantumDot
tools.one_line_profile: DFT solver for quantum dots with VTK visualization
tools.detailed_description: A C++ Density Functional Theory code using a plane wave basis, specifically designed for simulating quantum dots and visualizing orbitals.

tools.name: AtomPAW
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for Projector Augmented-Wave (PAW) atomic datasets
tools.detailed_description: AtomPAW is a tool for generating Projector Augmented-Wave (PAW) datasets for electronic structure calculations. It solves the atomic all-electron and pseudopotential problems and produces PAW setups used by various DFT codes.

tools.name: CP2K Editor
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for creating and editing CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to facilitate the creation of complex input files for the atomistic simulation program CP2K. It helps users manage the hierarchical input structure of CP2K.

tools.name: BandUP
tools.one_line_profile: Band Unfolding code for Plane-wave based calculations
tools.detailed_description: BandUP (Band Unfolding for Plane-waves) is a code that allows obtaining a primitive cell representation of the band structure of systems simulated using supercells. It is particularly useful for analyzing defects, alloys, or interfaces.

tools.name: Beautiful Atoms
tools.one_line_profile: High-quality rendering of atoms and molecules using Blender
tools.detailed_description: A Python module that interfaces with Blender to produce high-quality, ray-traced visualizations of atomic structures and molecules, suitable for scientific publications.

tools.name: CP2K QM/MM Input Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for preparing QM/MM CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A compilation of Python scripts developed by BioExcel to assist in the creation and setup of QM/MM (Quantum Mechanics/Molecular Mechanics) input files for the CP2K simulation package.

tools.name: vasppy
tools.one_line_profile: Python suite for manipulating VASP input and output
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate the manipulation of input and output files for the Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package (VASP), aiding in data extraction and calculation setup.

tools.name: Block2
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient parallel quantum chemistry DMRG solver
tools.detailed_description: An efficient parallel implementation of the Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) algorithm in the Matrix Product Operator (MPO) formalism for quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: ai2-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for AI-enhanced ab initio computational chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to integrate artificial intelligence with ab initio computational chemistry research, facilitating workflows that combine machine learning potentials with DFT calculations.

tools.name: CP2K
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
tools.detailed_description: CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid, molecular, and biological systems. It provides a general framework for different modeling methods such as DFT using the mixed Gaussian and Plane Waves (GPW) approaches.

tools.name: cp2k-input-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for validating and processing CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides capabilities for parsing, validating, and generating CP2K input files, ensuring compatibility with the CP2K input syntax.

tools.name: cp2k-output-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools to handle CP2K output files
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python tools designed to parse and extract data from CP2K output files, facilitating analysis of simulation results.

tools.name: DBCSR
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed Block Compressed Sparse Row matrix library
tools.detailed_description: DBCSR is a library for parallel sparse matrix operations, specifically designed for quantum chemistry applications like linear scaling DFT. It is the underlying math engine for CP2K's linear algebra operations.

tools.name: pslibrary
tools.one_line_profile: Library of ultrasoft and PAW pseudopotentials for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive collection of ultrasoft and Projector Augmented Wave (PAW) pseudopotentials for electronic structure calculations, specifically designed for use with the Quantum ESPRESSO package.

tools.name: thermo_pw
tools.one_line_profile: Driver for automatic computation of material properties using Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A driver that orchestrates Quantum ESPRESSO routines to automatically compute various ab-initio material properties, streamlining the workflow for thermodynamics and other physical properties.

tools.name: ce-tddft
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time Time-Dependent DFT implementation for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: An extension for Quantum ESPRESSO that enables Real-Time Time-Dependent Density Functional Theory (RT-TDDFT) calculations, allowing for the simulation of electron dynamics.

tools.name: qe-gipaw
tools.one_line_profile: GIPAW method implementation for NMR calculations in Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: The official Quantum ESPRESSO module for calculating NMR chemical shifts and EPR g-tensors using the Gauge-Including Projector Augmented Wave (GIPAW) method.

tools.name: DeepMD-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning package for many-body potential energy representation and MD
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning package that generates many-body potential energy surfaces and force fields for molecular dynamics, bridging the gap between ab initio accuracy and classical MD efficiency.

tools.name: dftbplus-ase
tools.one_line_profile: ASE calculator interface for DFTB+
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface that allows the DFTB+ (Density Functional Tight Binding) software to be used as a calculator within the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE).

tools.name: simple-dftd3
tools.one_line_profile: Reference implementation of the D3 dispersion correction
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing the D3 dispersion correction method for Density Functional Theory calculations, providing a standard way to include van der Waals interactions.

tools.name: dftd4
tools.one_line_profile: Atomic-Charge Dependent London Dispersion Correction (D4)
tools.detailed_description: The successor to DFT-D3, providing a generally applicable, atomic-charge dependent London dispersion correction for density functional theory calculations.

tools.name: DFT-FE
tools.one_line_profile: Real-space DFT calculations using Finite Elements
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel real-space Density Functional Theory code that uses finite element basis sets, enabling fast and accurate calculations for large-scale materials systems.

tools.name: PWDFT
tools.one_line_profile: Plane-Wave DFT development for NWChemEx
tools.detailed_description: A plane-wave density functional theory implementation developed as part of the NWChemEx electronic structure software project, targeting exascale computing platforms.

tools.name: vasptest
tools.one_line_profile: Test suite for the VASP electronic structure code
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive test suite designed to validate the installation and functionality of the VASP (Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package) electronic structure code.

tools.name: pwtools
tools.one_line_profile: Pre- and postprocessing package for atomistic calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for pre- and post-processing of atomistic calculations, supporting Quantum Espresso, CP2K, LAMMPS, and others, with powerful parsing and data storage capabilities.

tools.name: SIRIUS
tools.one_line_profile: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, domain-specific library for electronic structure calculations, providing GPU-accelerated solvers for DFT and supporting various basis sets.

tools.name: q-e-sirius
tools.one_line_profile: SIRIUS-enabled Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A version of Quantum ESPRESSO integrated with the SIRIUS library, enabling GPU acceleration and alternative solvers provided by the SIRIUS backend.

tools.name: PyDFTlj
tools.one_line_profile: Classical DFT solver for Lennard-Jones fluids
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation for solving classical Density Functional Theory (cDFT) problems for Lennard-Jones fluids in 1D and 3D geometries.

tools.name: koopmans
tools.one_line_profile: Koopmans-compliant functionals in Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing Koopmans-compliant functionals within the Quantum ESPRESSO ecosystem to accurately predict spectral properties like band gaps and ionization potentials.

tools.name: IFermi
tools.one_line_profile: Fermi surface generation, analysis and visualisation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line tool for the generation, analysis, and visualization of Fermi surfaces, integrating with VASP and other DFT codes.

tools.name: pyscfad
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF with auto-differentiation
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the PySCF library that supports automatic differentiation, enabling gradient-based optimization and machine learning applications in quantum chemistry.

tools.name: NanoNet
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for electronic structure and transport modeling (TB/NEGF)
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for electronic structure computations based on the tight-binding method and quantum transport modeling using the non-equilibrium Green's function (NEGF) method.

tools.name: qe-gpu
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A version of Quantum ESPRESSO ported to GPUs using CUDA Fortran, enabling accelerated electronic structure calculations on NVIDIA hardware.

tools.name: qe-gpu-plugin
tools.one_line_profile: Plug-in to accelerate Quantum ESPRESSO using NVIDIA GPU
tools.detailed_description: A plugin designed to offload specific computational kernels of Quantum ESPRESSO to NVIDIA GPUs for performance acceleration.

tools.name: VaspGibbs
tools.one_line_profile: Calculate Gibbs free energy from VASP calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to calculate Gibbs free energy and other thermodynamic properties from VASP output data using the quasi-harmonic approximation.

tools.name: Cube-Toolz
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool to manipulate Gaussian cube files
tools.detailed_description: A utility for manipulating Gaussian cube files, which are commonly used to store volumetric data like electron density and orbitals in computational chemistry.

tools.name: smatool
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for strength of materials calculations
tools.detailed_description: An open-source first-principles computational toolkit for calculating the mechanical strength of materials in 1D, 2D, and 3D systems at zero and finite temperatures.

tools.name: tetr_lev00_Chimera_plugin
tools.one_line_profile: UCSF Chimera plugin for Tetr pre-processing tool for DFT codes
tools.detailed_description: A UCSF Chimera plugin for Tetr - a pre-processing tool for DFT codes such as CP2K.

tools.name: pyscf-ipu
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF implementation optimized for IPU hardware
tools.detailed_description: PySCF on IPU.

tools.name: amset
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic transport properties calculator from first-principles
tools.detailed_description: Electronic transport properties from first-principles calculations.

tools.name: findTDE
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for calculating threshold displacement energies in VASP/LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: Set of scripts to facilitate easy calculations of threshold displacement energies for materials in VASP/LAMMPS using ab initio/classical molecular dynamics.

tools.name: fci-siso
tools.one_line_profile: State Interaction Spin-Orbit (SISO) Method for CASSCF and FCI
tools.detailed_description: State Interaction Spin-Orbit (SISO) Method for CASSCF and FCI.

tools.name: FCP-vasp-ase
tools.one_line_profile: ASE interface for fully constant potential calculations with VASP
tools.detailed_description: ASE interface for fully constant potential with VASP.

tools.name: GASP-python
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic algorithm for structure and phase prediction
tools.detailed_description: Genetic algorithm for structure and phase prediction interfaced to GULP, LAMMPS and VASP.

tools.name: VASPsol
tools.one_line_profile: Solvation model implementation for VASP
tools.detailed_description: Solvation model for the plane wave DFT code VASP.

tools.name: lev00
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization program for ab initio DFT codes (VASP, SIESTA, QE)
tools.detailed_description: L. N. Kantorovich, User-friendly visualisation program for ab initio DFT codes VASP, SIESTA, QE and QUICKSTEP.

tools.name: mcu
tools.one_line_profile: Modeling and Crystallographic Utilities
tools.detailed_description: Modeling and Crystallographic Utilities.

tools.name: pyWannier90
tools.one_line_profile: Wannier90 python interface for VASP and PySCF
tools.detailed_description: A Wannier90 python interface for VASP and PySCF.

tools.name: somd
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics package for SIESTA DFT code
tools.detailed_description: Molecular dynamics package designed for the SIESTA DFT code.

tools.name: ASE_ANI
tools.one_line_profile: ANI-1 neural net potential interface for ASE
tools.detailed_description: ANI-1 neural net potential with python interface (ASE).

tools.name: vasputil
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities and Python libraries for VASP
tools.detailed_description: Command-line utilities and Python libraries designed to make life with VASP easier.

tools.name: ExSCF
tools.one_line_profile: Spin-projected Unrestricted Hartree-Fock program
tools.detailed_description: Spin-projected Unrestricted Hartree-Fock program.

tools.name: pyAutoMR
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Multi-Reference methods based on PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Automatic MR based on PySCF.

tools.name: pyNOF
tools.one_line_profile: Natural-orbital Functional implementation based on PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Natural-orbital Functional based on PySCF.

tools.name: AbInitioVO-and-FastFloppyTail
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for Protein Structure Prediction from Sequence
tools.detailed_description: AbInitio Variable Order and FastFloppyTail Algorithms for Protein Structure Prediction from Sequence.

tools.name: amaceing_toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Input creation and post-processing toolkit for CP2K, MACE, and others
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the creation of input files for CP2K, MACE-torch, MatterSim, SevenNet, ORB and Grace as well as the post-processing and evaluation of these simulations.

tools.name: disorder
tools.one_line_profile: Code for generating irreducible site-occupancy configurations
tools.detailed_description: A code for generating irreducible site-occupancy configurations.

tools.name: vasp-interface
tools.one_line_profile: ASE compliant Python interface to VASP
tools.detailed_description: New ASE compliant Python interface to VASP.

tools.name: bf_auger
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles Auger recombination calculations
tools.detailed_description: First-principles Auger calculations.

tools.name: qe-util
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for using Quantum-Espresso with ASE
tools.detailed_description: Set of utilities for using Quantum-Espresso with ASE and ipython notebooks.

tools.name: RealtimePySCF
tools.one_line_profile: Realtime Time-Dependent DFT extensions to PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Realtime Extensions to PySCF (TDDFT etc.).

tools.name: vaspup2.0
tools.one_line_profile: VASP Convergence Testing Scripts
tools.detailed_description: VASP Convergence Testing (for Energy & Dielectric Constants).

tools.name: pyscf2gfn
tools.one_line_profile: Interface using GFn-XTB as relaxation engine for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Parser code written in Python for using GFn-XTB as a relaxation engine for providing relaxed structures to PySCF directly within the same script.

tools.name: ABACUS-Pseudopot-Nao-Square
tools.one_line_profile: Pseudopotential and Numerical Atomic Orbital library for ABACUS
tools.detailed_description: Enpower ABACUS calculation, for high efficiency, for high precision. Pseudopotential and Numerical Atomic Orbital library (developing).

tools.name: pydefect
tools.one_line_profile: Point-defect calculations library for VASP
tools.detailed_description: Python library for point-defect calculations in non-metallic solids based on first-principle calculations with the VASP code.

tools.name: mp2-variants
tools.one_line_profile: Regularized variants of MP2 for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Regularized variants of MP2 for use in PySCF.

tools.name: MuST
tools.one_line_profile: Multiple Scattering Theory code for first principles calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Multiple Scattering Theory (MST) based code for performing first-principles electronic structure calculations. It is part of the MST suite and is designed for studying disordered systems and other complex materials properties.

tools.name: LSMS
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable first principles calculations using locally self-consistent multiple scattering theory
tools.detailed_description: The Locally Self-consistent Multiple Scattering (LSMS) code is a first-principles electronic structure method designed for high scalability on supercomputers. It calculates the electronic structure of materials using multiple scattering theory, suitable for large systems.

tools.name: CumuPy
tools.one_line_profile: Cumulant expansion of Green's function for photoemission spectroscopy
tools.detailed_description: A Python code designed to compute the cumulant expansion of the Green's function, specifically for analyzing photoemission spectroscopy data in the context of electronic structure theory.

tools.name: automatic-differentiation-SCF
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Differentiation for Hartree-Fock Direct Minimization
tools.detailed_description: A source code implementation utilizing automatic differentiation techniques for the direct minimization approach to the Hartree-Fock method, facilitating gradient-based optimization in electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: EPW-nano
tools.one_line_profile: Modified EPW code for electron transport and thermoelectric properties
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the EPW (Electron-Phonon Wannier) code tailored for calculating electron transport and thermoelectric properties of materials. It includes features for electron-phonon scattering, defect scattering, and phonon drag.

tools.name: cp2k-spm-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Scanning probe microscopy simulation tools for CP2K
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python tools designed to simulate Scanning Probe Microscopy (SPM) images and data based on output from the CP2K electronic structure package.

tools.name: QERaman
tools.one_line_profile: First-order resonance Raman spectroscopy calculator for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: An open-source program that interfaces with Quantum ESPRESSO to compute first-order resonance Raman spectroscopy intensities and spectra.

tools.name: cp2k-analysis-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tools for CP2K and other simulation software
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python scripts and tools for analyzing output data from CP2K and potentially other atomistic simulation software, facilitating data extraction and processing.

tools.name: ad-dfpt
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithmic differentiation for plane-wave DFT
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of algorithmic differentiation (AD) techniques applied to plane-wave Density Functional Theory (DFT) and Density Functional Perturbation Theory (DFPT), enabling automatic computation of derivatives.

tools.name: TopoToolsSiesta
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for the study of topological materials with Siesta
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools designed to interface with the Siesta DFT code for the analysis and characterization of topological materials properties.

tools.name: MathemticaForDFTnSPM
tools.one_line_profile: Mathematica notebooks for processing DFT and SPM simulation outputs
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Mathematica notebooks serving as a toolbox for processing, plotting, and visualizing outputs from various DFT codes (VASP, FHI-AIMS, Fireball, GPAW) and SPM simulations.

tools.name: p4vasp
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for VASP
tools.detailed_description: A visualization suite specifically designed for the VASP DFT package, allowing users to view structures, densities, and other calculation outputs.

tools.name: DFT_1d
tools.one_line_profile: Library for 1-dimensional DFT calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing and analyzing 1-dimensional Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations, useful for educational purposes and simplified model studies.

tools.name: cp2k-basis
tools.one_line_profile: Library to parse and select CP2K basis sets and pseudopotentials
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and web tool designed to parse CP2K basis sets and GTH pseudopotentials, helping users select matching basis sets and potentials for their calculations.

tools.name: Atomsk
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for manipulating and converting atomic data files
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool for creating, manipulating, and converting atomic structure files for various computational materials science codes (LAMMPS, VASP, Quantum ESPRESSO, etc.).

tools.name: DFTtoolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for building inputs and analyzing results of DFT codes
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox designed to streamline the workflow of Density Functional Theory calculations, offering functionality for input generation and result analysis.

tools.name: ONCVPSP
tools.one_line_profile: Optimized Norm-Conserving Vanderbilt Pseudopotentials for Quantum Espresso
tools.detailed_description: A collection/tool related to Optimized Norm-Conserving Vanderbilt Pseudopotentials (ONCVPSP) specifically formatted for use with Quantum ESPRESSO.

tools.name: agate
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing software for Abinit data
tools.detailed_description: Open-source software designed to post-process data generated by the Abinit DFT code, facilitating analysis of electronic structure results.

tools.name: qAgate
tools.one_line_profile: Qt interface for agate post-processing tool
tools.detailed_description: A Graphical User Interface (GUI) built with Qt for the 'agate' post-processing tool, making it easier to analyze Abinit data visually.

tools.name: pymol-cp2k-qmmm
tools.one_line_profile: PyMol script to generate CP2K QMMM input sections
tools.detailed_description: A PyMol script that assists in generating and loading the QMMM (Quantum Mechanics/Molecular Mechanics) section of CP2K input files, bridging visualization and simulation setup.

tools.name: wxDragon
tools.one_line_profile: Automated DFT Input File Generator
tools.detailed_description: A tool utilizing wxDragon to automate the generation of input files for Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations.

tools.name: cc-diagrams
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic diagram and code generation for coupled-cluster equations
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the automatic generation of diagrams and corresponding code for quantum chemistry coupled-cluster equations, aiding in the development of electronic structure methods.

tools.name: local-pyscf
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of local algorithms within PySCF
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the PySCF package that implements local correlation algorithms, aiming to improve the efficiency of quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: pyiron_atomistics
tools.one_line_profile: Interfaces for atomistic simulation codes and workflows
tools.detailed_description: Part of the pyiron project, this module provides interfaces and workflow management for various atomistic simulation codes, enabling integrated computational materials science.

tools.name: pyiron
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated development environment for computational materials science
tools.detailed_description: An integrated development environment (IDE) and workflow management system specifically designed for computational materials science, supporting complex simulation protocols and data management.

tools.name: pyiron_atomistics_pkg
tools.one_line_profile: IDE for atomistic simulation in computational materials science
tools.detailed_description: The specific package within the pyiron ecosystem dedicated to atomistic simulations, providing the core functionality for setting up and running atomic-scale calculations.

tools.name: pyscf-dispersion
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF extensions for dispersion calculations
tools.detailed_description: An extension module for the PySCF package that adds capabilities for calculating dispersion interactions in electronic structure theory.

tools.name: gpu4pyscf
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin to use Nvidia GPU in PySCF package
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PySCF that enables hardware acceleration using NVIDIA GPUs, significantly speeding up electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: mpi4pyscf
tools.one_line_profile: MPI parallelization for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: An extension for PySCF that provides MPI (Message Passing Interface) parallelization, allowing calculations to be distributed across multiple computing nodes.

tools.name: PySCF
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based simulations of chemistry framework
tools.detailed_description: PySCF is an open-source collection of electronic structure modules powered by Python. It supports Hartree-Fock, DFT, MP2, coupled cluster, and other quantum chemistry methods.

tools.name: pyscf-forge
tools.one_line_profile: Staging repository for experimental PySCF extensions
tools.detailed_description: A collection of experimental modules and extensions for the PySCF quantum chemistry package, serving as a staging ground for features before integration into the core.

tools.name: pyscf-tblis
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF interface for the TBLIS tensor contraction library
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper allowing PySCF to utilize the TBLIS library for efficient tensor contractions in quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: pyscfcli
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line interface tools for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Provides command-line utilities to run and manage PySCF calculations without writing full Python scripts.

tools.name: pyscf-semiempirical
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-empirical methods extension for PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Implements semi-empirical quantum chemistry methods (like MINDO, AM1, PM3) within the PySCF framework.

tools.name: Qiskit Nature PySCF
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF driver plugin for Qiskit Nature
tools.detailed_description: Allows Qiskit Nature to use PySCF as a backend for electronic structure calculations, bridging classical quantum chemistry and quantum computing simulations.

tools.name: Qsnake ASE
tools.one_line_profile: Qsnake distribution of the Atomic Simulation Environment
tools.detailed_description: A packaged version of the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) tailored for the Qsnake distribution, used for setting up, manipulating, and running atomistic simulations.

tools.name: Qsnake GPAW
tools.one_line_profile: Qsnake mirror of the GPAW DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A mirror of the GPAW density functional theory code, likely maintained for the Qsnake scientific computing environment.

tools.name: OpenFermion-PySCF
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF interface for OpenFermion
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for OpenFermion that enables the use of PySCF to generate molecular Hamiltonians and perform electronic structure calculations for quantum algorithms.

tools.name: VASP-Raman
tools.one_line_profile: Off-resonance Raman activity calculator using VASP
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to calculate off-resonance Raman activity and intensity by interfacing with VASP to compute macroscopic dielectric tensors.

tools.name: MAGMATOMIX-UMD_package
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for ab initio molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A post-processing package for analyzing structural, transport, and thermodynamic properties from ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) simulations.

tools.name: dft-gpu
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Plane Wave DFT Code
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Plane Wave Density Functional Theory designed to run on GPUs for accelerated electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: LOBSTERWF2XSF
tools.one_line_profile: LOBSTER wavefunction to XSF converter
tools.detailed_description: A C++ utility to convert 3D wavefunction files from the LOBSTER code into XSF format for visualization.

tools.name: VASP2ABINIT
tools.one_line_profile: VASP POSCAR to ABINIT input converter
tools.detailed_description: A C++ tool to convert VASP structure files (POSCAR) into ABINIT input format, facilitating interoperability between DFT codes.

tools.name: gamma
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic structure code for intermolecular interactions
tools.detailed_description: An efficient, high-accuracy electronic structure code specifically designed for calculating intermolecular interactions.

tools.name: cp2kdata
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing tools for CP2K
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing tools for parsing and analyzing output data from the CP2K quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package.

tools.name: mdwc3
tools.one_line_profile: Ab-initio molecular dynamics library
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing and analyzing ab-initio molecular dynamics simulations, developed by the Romero Group.

tools.name: pyprocar
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic structure pre/post-processing library
tools.detailed_description: A robust Python library for analyzing and plotting electronic structure data (bands, DOS, Fermi surfaces) from codes like VASP, QE, and Elk.

tools.name: PyGW
tools.one_line_profile: G0W0 and GW0 electronic structure code
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based electronic structure code implementing G0W0 and GW0 approximations for calculating quasiparticle energies in realistic materials.

tools.name: dft-transport
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum transport library coupled to CP2K
tools.detailed_description: A library for calculating quantum transport properties using Density Functional Theory, designed to interface with the CP2K package.

tools.name: gpaw-tools
tools.one_line_profile: GUI and tools for GPAW DFT calculations
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly interface and toolset for conducting Density Functional Theory (DFT) and molecular dynamics (MD) calculations using the GPAW code.

tools.name: neuralxc
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learned density functional implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for implementing and using machine learning-based exchange-correlation functionals in Density Functional Theory calculations.

tools.name: ElATools
tools.one_line_profile: Analyzer for anisotropic elastic properties
tools.detailed_description: A tool for post-processing and analyzing the anisotropic elastic properties of 2D and 3D materials from ab initio calculation data.

tools.name: SHARC
tools.one_line_profile: Excited-state molecular dynamics suite
tools.detailed_description: The SHARC (Surface Hopping including ARbitrary Couplings) suite is an ab initio molecular dynamics software package for studying excited-state dynamics.

tools.name: SHARC4
tools.one_line_profile: SHARC molecular dynamics suite (Version 4)
tools.detailed_description: Repository for version 4 of the SHARC molecular dynamics program suite, used for non-adiabatic dynamics simulations.

tools.name: aiida-siesta
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the SIESTA DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that enables the automation and management of calculations using the SIESTA density functional theory code.

tools.name: flos
tools.one_line_profile: Lua interface for SIESTA via flook
tools.detailed_description: A library that interfaces the SIESTA DFT code with Lua scripts using the flook library, enabling flexible control over MD and optimization processes.

tools.name: GUI4dft
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical User Interface for SIESTA
tools.detailed_description: A free graphical user interface designed primarily for the SIESTA DFT package, facilitating input creation and output visualization.

tools.name: MultiOptPy
tools.one_line_profile: Geometry optimization tools for quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing multifunctional geometry optimization algorithms for quantum chemical calculations.

tools.name: VASP_script
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of useful scripts for VASP pre- and post-processing
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive set of Python scripts designed to assist with VASP calculations, including structure manipulation, input generation, and data extraction.

tools.name: TenCirChem
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum computational chemistry package based on TensorCircuit
tools.detailed_description: An efficient quantum computational chemistry software package built on TensorCircuit, enabling variational quantum algorithms for molecular simulation.

tools.name: Inelastica
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for electron transport and phonon analysis with SIESTA/TranSIESTA
tools.detailed_description: A tool for calculating eigenchannels, vibrational modes, and inelastic electron transport properties (IETS) based on DFT output from SIESTA and TranSIESTA.

tools.name: JARVIS-Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source software package for data-driven atomistic materials design
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive python library for atomistic materials design, including tools for high-throughput DFT calculations, machine learning force fields, and database management.

tools.name: pymlff
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight package for handling VASP machine learning force field files
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool specifically designed to read, write, and analyze VASP ML_AB files, facilitating the use of machine learning force fields in VASP.

tools.name: ACES
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper for computational codes of thermal conductivity
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that interfaces with various computational codes to facilitate the calculation of thermal conductivity in materials.

tools.name: py4vasp
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python interface for VASP
tools.detailed_description: The official Python interface for the VASP software package, allowing users to extract data from VASP HDF5 output files and perform post-processing analysis.

tools.name: ase-espresso
tools.one_line_profile: ASE interface for Quantum Espresso
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface connecting the Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) with the Quantum Espresso DFT package, enabling the setup and execution of QE calculations via ASE.

tools.name: yambopy
tools.one_line_profile: Python scripts to manage and postprocess Quantum Espresso and Yambo calculations
tools.detailed_description: The official Python interface for the Yambo code, providing tools for setting up calculations, managing workflows, and analyzing results from Yambo and Quantum Espresso.

tools.name: TransOpt
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for calculating electrical transport properties from VASP
tools.detailed_description: A package that enables VASP users to calculate electrical transport properties such as Seebeck coefficients and electrical conductivities using momentum matrix or derivative methods.

tools.name: QEbandplot
tools.one_line_profile: Python scripts for plotting Quantum Espresso band structures
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool for visualizing band structures generated by Quantum Espresso (pwscf) bands.x output files.

tools.name: sisl
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic structure package for large scale tight-binding and NEGF calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for manipulating atomic structures and performing large-scale tight-binding DFT and non-equilibrium Green's function (NEGF) calculations and analysis.

tools.name: TCCL-Code
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for theoretical and computational chemistry data processing
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts for processing output from various quantum chemistry codes like ADF, CP2K, Gaussian, and NWChem, developed at Tsinghua University.

tools.name: VaspCZ
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient VASP computation assistant and high-throughput tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based assistant for VASP calculations that supports static optimization, transition state calculations, vibration analysis, and high-throughput workflows.

tools.name: IRVSP
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for obtaining irreducible representations of electronic states from VASP output
tools.detailed_description: IRVSP is a computational tool designed to calculate the irreducible representations (irreps) of electronic states for all 230 space groups, supporting systems with or without spin-orbit coupling (SOC). It interfaces directly with the VASP package to analyze wavefunctions (WAVECAR) and is essential for identifying topological materials and analyzing band symmetry.
